meanings.definition: Present participle of tender: offering or presenting something for consideration or acceptance.
meanings.sent1: The tendering flowers added a colorful touch to the garden.
meanings.sent2: She looked at the tendering gift with a smile.
meanings.sent3: The tendering cake looked too pretty to eat.
meanings.sent4: The sky turned a tendering pink as the sun set.
meanings.sent5: The tendering melody filled the room with warmth.

meanings.definition: Gerund of tender: the act of submitting a bid or proposal for a project or contract.
meanings.sent1: His tendering of the construction project was well-received.
meanings.sent2: The company won the contract through a successful tendering process.
meanings.sent3: The tendering for the new office building became a heated competition.
meanings.sent4: Her tendering for the art commission showcased her talent.
meanings.sent5: The tendering for the renovation project required attention to detail.
